text:
I was going to devil’s advocate this as well: “If ISeC doesn’t have any security
flaws like the other products, who cares. Make a case about successfully
patching.” 
Then to devil’s advocate myself, I realized it’s not a product security issue,
it’s a company security issue. Who knows if there are flaws in this product? 
It’s an old code base that’s been bounced around a lot. If they continually have
issues with any of their products, I’d have to assume they’re not taking
security seriously everywhere. This sounds like the situation that the OP has
been put into. 
A vulnerable patch management system would be nasty. Thanks for adding to the
list of things to keep me awake at night. 
%40IA2PR16MB6494.namprd16.prod.outlook.com

metadata.subject: RE: [patchmanagement] If not Ivanti, what?
